column4: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Security, as long as you dont install internet services without doing something about security you'll be ok
think you meant to respond to someone else... not me
i read a way to move processes from one machine to another
there are specific language channels, what language do you need?
it demonstrates that when asking a question one must be a definitive as possible. so techincally removing a file does *hide* it.
he asked how to hide a file and got told how to remove a file in a desctucive non-recoverable way
again. questions asked need to be more definitive. not so vague.
if the question is vague then you ask for clarification?
but its a still a valid response. until clarification is given.
i dont see how giving people comands that remove their files when its not clear that that is what they want is helpful in any way
about as helpful as vague questions
